definitions.text: a person who is frightened and in need of help
examples: they prey on the hopes of the desperate

definitions.text: arising from or marked by despair or loss of hope
examples: a despairing view of the world situation
the last despairing plea of the condemned criminal
helpless and desperate--as if at the end of his tether

definitions.text: (of persons) dangerously reckless or violent as from urgency or despair
showing extreme courage; especially of actions courageously undertaken in desperation as a last resort; ; - G.C.Marshall
examples: made a last desperate attempt to reach the climber
the desperate gallantry of our naval task forces marked the turning point in the Pacific war
they took heroic measures to save his life

definitions.text: showing extreme urgency or intensity especially because of great need or desire
examples: felt a desperate urge to confess

definitions.text: fraught with extreme danger; nearly hopeless; ; - G.C.Marshall
examples: on all fronts the Allies were in a desperate situation due to lack of materiel
